intro: Melicope cinereops, commonly known as the ash-leaf melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive ash-gray coloration on the underside. Melicope cinereops is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
